verses.verse: And the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> again<WH3254> did<WH6213> evil<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of the Lord<WH3068>, when Ehud<WH164> was dead<WH4191>.

And the Lord<WH3068> sold<WH4376> them into the hand<WH3027> of Jabin<WH2985> king<WH4428> of Canaan<WH3667>, that reigned<WH4427> in Hazor<WH2674>; the captain<WH8269> of whose host<WH6635> was Sisera<WH5516>, which lived<WH3427> in Harosheth<WH2800> of the Nations<WH1471>.

And the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> cried<WH6817> unto the Lord<WH3068>: for he had nine<WH8672> hundred<WH3967> chariots<WH7393> of iron<WH1270>; and twenty<WH6242> years<WH8141> he mightily<WH2394> oppressed<WH3905> the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>.
And Deborah<WH1683>, a prophetess<WH5031>, the wife<WH802> of Lapidoth<WH3941>, she judged<WH8199> Israel<WH3478> at that time<WH6256>.

And she lived<WH3427> under the palm tree<WH8560> of Deborah<WH1683> between Ramah<WH7414> and Beth<WH1008>–el in mountain<WH2022> Ephraim<WH669>: and the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> came up<WH5927> to her for judgment<WH4941>.

And she sent<WH7971> and called<WH7121> Barak<WH1301> the son<WH1121> of Abinoam<WH42> out of Kedesh<WH6943>–naphtali, and said<WH559> unto him<WH3068>, Has not the Lord God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478> commanded<WH6680>, saying<WH3212>, Go and draw<WH4900> toward mountain<WH2022> Tabor<WH8396>, and take<WH3947> with you ten<WH6235> thousand<WH505> men<WH376> of the sons<WH1121> of Naphtali<WH5321> and of the sons<WH1121> of Zebulun<WH2074>?

And I will draw<WH4900> unto you to the river<WH5158> Kishon<WH7028> Sisera<WH5516>, the captain<WH8269> of Jabin<WH2985>'s army<WH6635>, with his chariots<WH7393> and his multitude<WH1995>; and I will deliver<WH5414> him into your hand<WH3027>.
And Barak<WH1301> said<WH559> unto her<WH3212>, If you will go with me<WH1980>, then I will go: but if you will not go<WH3212> with me<WH3212>, then I will not go.

And she said<WH559>, I will surely<WH1980> go<WH3212> with you<WH657>: nevertheless the journey<WH1870> that you take<WH1980> shall not be for your honor<WH8597>; for the Lord<WH3068> shall sell<WH4376> Sisera<WH5516> into the hand<WH3027> of a woman<WH802>. And Deborah<WH1683> arose<WH6965>, and went<WH3212> with Barak<WH1301> to Kedesh<WH6943>.

And Barak<WH1301> called<WH2199> Zebulun<WH2074> and Naphtali<WH5321> to Kedesh<WH6943>; and he went up<WH5927> with ten<WH6235> thousand<WH505> men<WH376> at his feet<WH7272>: and Deborah<WH1683> went up with him<WH5927>.

Now Heber<WH2268> the Kenite<WH7017>, which was of the sons<WH1121> of Hobab<WH2246> the father in law<WH2859> of Moses<WH4872>, had separated<WH6504> himself from the Kenites<WH7017>, and pitched<WH5186> his tent<WH168> unto the plain<WH436> of Zaanaim<WH6815>, which is by Kedesh<WH6943>.
And they showed<WH5046> Sisera<WH5516> that Barak<WH1301> the son<WH1121> of Abinoam<WH42> was gone up<WH5927> to mountain<WH2022> Tabor<WH8396>.

And Sisera<WH5516> gathered together<WH2199> all his chariots<WH7393>, even nine<WH8672> hundred<WH3967> chariots<WH7393> of iron<WH1270>, and all the people<WH5971> that were with him<WH2800>, from Harosheth of the Nations<WH1471> unto the river<WH5158> of Kishon<WH7028>.

And Deborah<WH1683> said<WH559> unto Barak<WH1301>, Up<WH6965>; for this is the day<WH3117> in which the Lord<WH3068> has delivered<WH5414> Sisera<WH5516> into your hand<WH3027>: is not the Lord<WH3068> gone out<WH3318> before<WH6440> you So Barak<WH1301> went down<WH3381> from mountain<WH2022> Tabor<WH8396>, and ten<WH6235> thousand<WH505> men<WH376> after him<WH310>.

And the Lord<WH3068> defeated<WH2000> Sisera<WH5516>, and all his chariots<WH7393>, and all his host<WH4264>, with the edge<WH6310> of the sword<WH2719> before<WH6440> Barak<WH1301>; so that Sisera<WH5516> lighted down<WH3381> off his chariot<WH4818>, and fled away<WH5127> on his feet<WH7272>.

But Barak<WH1301> pursued<WH7291> after<WH310> the chariots<WH7393>, and after the host<WH4264>, unto Harosheth<WH2800> of the Nations<WH1471>: and all the host<WH4264> of Sisera<WH5516> fell<WH5307> upon the edge<WH6310> of the sword<WH2719>; and there was not a man<WH259> left<WH7604>.

But Sisera<WH5516> fled away<WH5127> on his feet<WH7272> to the tent<WH168> of Jael<WH3278> the wife<WH802> of Heber<WH2268> the Kenite<WH7017>: for there was peace<WH7965> between Jabin<WH2985> the king<WH4428> of Hazor<WH2674> and the house<WH1004> of Heber<WH2268> the Kenite<WH7017>.

And Jael<WH3278> went out<WH3318> to meet<WH7125> Sisera<WH5516>, and said<WH559> unto him<WH5493>, Turn in, my lord<WH113>, turn in<WH5493> to me<WH3372>; fear not<WH5493>. And when he had turned in unto her into the tent<WH168>, she covered<WH3680> him with a mantle<WH8063>.

And he said<WH559> unto her<WH4592>, Give me, I pray you, a little water<WH4325> to drink<WH8248>; for I am thirsty<WH6770>. And she opened<WH6605> a bottle<WH4997> of milk<WH2461>, and gave him drink<WH8248>, and covered him<WH3680>.

Again he said<WH559> unto her<WH5975>, Stand in the door<WH6607> of the tent<WH168>, and it shall be<WH376>, when any man does come<WH935> and inquire<WH7592> of you<WH559>, and say, Is there<WH3426> any man<WH376> here<WH3426>? that you shall say<WH559>, No.

Then Jael<WH3278> Heber<WH2268>'s wife<WH802> took<WH3947> a nail<WH3489> of the tent<WH168>, and took<WH7760> an hammer<WH4718> in her hand<WH3027>, and went<WH935> softly<WH3814> unto him<WH8628>, and struck the nail<WH3489> into his temples<WH7541>, and fastened<WH6795> it into the ground<WH776>: for he was fast asleep<WH7290> and weary<WH5774>. So he died<WH4191>.

And<WH1301>, behold, as Barak pursued<WH7291> Sisera<WH5516>, Jael<WH3278> came out<WH3318> to meet<WH7125> him<WH559>, and said unto him<WH3212>, Come, and I will show<WH7200> you the man<WH376> whom you seekest<WH1245>. And when he came<WH935> into her tent<WH5516>, behold, Sisera lay<WH5307> dead<WH4191>, and the nail<WH3489> was in his temples<WH7541>.
So God<WH430> subdued<WH3665> on that day<WH3117> Jabin<WH2985> the king<WH4428> of Canaan<WH3667> before<WH6440> the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>.

And the hand<WH3027> of the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> prospered<WH3212>, and prevailed<WH7186> against Jabin<WH2985> the king<WH4428> of Canaan<WH3667>, until they had destroyed<WH3772> Jabin<WH2985> king<WH4428> of Canaan<WH3667>.
